title: Siagro+
text:
Estadisticas de la actividad agropecuaria, desarrollo rural, seguridad alimentaria y nutricional y cambio clim√°tico de Centroam√©rica y M√©xico
El Sistema de Informaci√≥n Agropecuaria (SIAGRO) contiene informaci√≥n de variables de la actividad agropecuaria, desarrollo rural, seguridad alimentaria y variables clim√°ticas. Considera once pa√≠ses en su cobertura geogr√°fica: Belice, Costa Rica, Cuba, El Salvador, Guatemala, Hait√≠, Honduras, M√©xico, Nicaragua, Panam√° y Rep√∫blica Dominicana, y contiene datos anuales y mensuales. SIAGRO es impulsado por la Unidad de Desarrollo Agr√≠cola y Cambio Clim√°tico en la Sede Subregional en M√©xico de la CEPAL. La informaci√≥n se origina en la CEPAL o en otras bases de datos de agencias asociadas, y cada indicador tiene una explicaci√≥n de su fuente y metadatos.


Statistics on agricultural activity, rural development, food and nutritional security and climate change in Central America and Mexico
The Agricultural Information System (SIAGRO) contains information on agricultural activity, rural development, food security and climate variables. It covers eleven countries: Belize, Costa Rica, Cuba, The Dominican Republic, El Salvador, Guatemala, Haiti, Honduras, Mexico, Nicaragua and Panama, and contains annual and monthly data. SIAGRO is maintained by the Agricultural Development and Climate Change Unit at ECLAC‚Äôs Subregional Headquarters in Mexico. The information originates from either ECLAC or other partner agency databases, and each indicator comes with an explanation of its source and metadata.

title: Agricultural activities
text:
Agricultural activity refers to the economic aspects of agriculture and includes data on production, prices, international trade, cultivation and yields, exchange rates, economic activity and public spending.
Content content content

title: Rural development
text: Rural development is directly related to agricultural production since people in rural areas often rely more heavily on agriculture. This section includes data on demographics, education, employment and income, housing and public expenditure and investment

title: Climate data
text:
Climatic variables impact directly on agricultural production. This section includes annual and monthly data on temperature and precipitation at a national level.
Las variables clim√°ticas inciden directamente en la producci√≥n agr√≠cola. Esta secci√≥n incluye datos anuales y mensuales de temperatura y precipitaci√≥n a nivel nacional.





    

            Belice
            Costa Rica
            Cuba
            El Salvador
            Guatemala
            Hait√≠
            Honduras
            M√©xico
            Nicaragua
            Panam√°
            Rep√∫blica Dominicana

title: Food and nutrition security
text: Food and nutrition security refers to not just the supply of food to a population but is also about ensuring availability, stability and access to food. This section contains data on nutritional conditions, availability, access, acceptability, biological utilization and the structural aspects of food and nutrition security.

title: Climate change
text:
Climate change can impact on the production potential of all agricultural sectors though the change in both the levels and variability of climate variables. This section includes data on climate variables at a subnational level based on different climate change scenarios.
El cambio clim√°tico puede afectar el potencial productivo de todos los sectores agr√≠colas a trav√©s del cambio tanto en los niveles como en la variabilidad de las variables clim√°ticas. Esta secci√≥n incluye datos sobre variables clim√°ticas a nivel subnacional basados en diferentes escenarios de cambio clim√°tico.

title: Simple Chart Test
text:
from pyecharts.charts import Line
from pyecharts import options as opts

# Create a simple line chart
chart = Line()
chart.add_xaxis(['Jan', 'Feb', 'Mar', 'Apr', 'May', 'Jun'])
chart.add_yaxis('Test Series', [20, 22, 24, 26, 25, 23])

chart.set_global_opts(
    title_opts=opts.TitleOpts(title="Simple Test Chart"),
)

chart.render("charts/simple_test.html")
print("Chart saved to charts/simple_test.html")

Chart saved to charts/simple_test.html

title: Test First Chart
text:
import pandas as pd
from utils_siagro import cepal_data
from pyecharts.charts import Line
from pyecharts import options as opts

# Fetch data
df = cepal_data([4470], lang='en')

# Filter
if 'dim_85162' in df.columns:
    df_filtered = df[df['dim_85162'] == 85163].copy()
else:
    df_filtered = df.copy()

df_filtered['value'] = pd.to_numeric(df_filtered['value'], errors='coerce')

# Find columns
region_col = None
month_col = None

for col in df_filtered.columns:
    col_lower = col.lower()
    if 'division' in col_lower or 'country' in col_lower or 'area' in col_lower:
        if region_col is None:
            region_col = col
    if 'month' in col_lower:
        month_col = col

print(f"Region column: {region_col}")
print(f"Month column: {month_col}")

# Create simple chart for Belize
belize_data = df_filtered[df_filtered[region_col] == 'Belize'].copy()
print(f"Belize data shape: {belize_data.shape}")
print(f"Belize data:\n{belize_data.head()}")

# Group by month
monthly = belize_data.groupby(month_col)['value'].mean().reset_index()
print(f"\nMonthly data:\n{monthly}")

# Create chart
chart = Line()
months = monthly[month_col].tolist()
temps = monthly['value'].round(2).tolist()

print(f"Months: {months}")
print(f"Temps: {temps}")

chart.add_xaxis(months)
chart.add_yaxis("Belize", temps)
chart.set_global_opts(title_opts=opts.TitleOpts(title="Belize Temperature"))
chart.render("charts/test_belize.html")
print("Saved to charts/test_belize.html")
